about.name: Marrakech
about.info_text: Marrakech is a mesmerizing city located in the heart of Morocco. Known as the 'Red City' due to its distinctive clay architecture, Marrakech is a vibrant and historic destination that blends tradition and modernity. The city boasts a rich cultural heritage, colorful souks, intricate architecture, and a lively medina. Visitors can explore the bustling markets, admire the stunning palaces and gardens, and savor the flavors of Moroccan cuisine. Marrakech is a city that engages all the senses and offers an unforgettable experience.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 928,850
Region: Marrakech-Safi
Time Zone: Western European Time (UTC+00:00)
Language: Arabic, Berber, French
Currency: Moroccan Dirham (MAD)
about.climate_text: Marrakech enjoys a semi-arid climate with hot summers and mild winters. The city is known for its abundant sunshine and is a popular year-round destination for travelers.

attractions_card.title: Jardin Majorelle
attractions_card.description: Jardin Majorelle is a stunning garden designed by French painter Jacques Majorelle. It features exotic plants, vibrant blue buildings, and a serene atmosphere.

attractions_card.title: Medina of Marrakech
attractions_card.description: The historic Medina of Marrakech is a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its labyrinthine streets, bustling souks, and iconic landmarks like Koutoubia Mosque.

attractions_card.title: Bahia Palace
attractions_card.description: Bahia Palace is a 19th-century palace with beautifully decorated rooms and lush gardens, showcasing Moroccan architecture and craftsmanship.

attractions_card.title: Saadian Tombs
attractions_card.description: The Saadian Tombs are a hidden gem containing the tombs of Saadian dynasty members, discovered in 1917 and featuring intricate tilework.

attractions_card.title: Koutoubia Mosque
attractions_card.description: The Koutoubia Mosque is the largest mosque in Marrakech and is famous for its stunning minaret, a masterpiece of Almohad architecture.

attractions_card.title: Djemaa el Fna
attractions_card.description: Djemaa el Fna is Marrakech's central square, where you can experience the vibrant atmosphere, street performances, food stalls, and market shopping.

attractions_card.title: Majorelle Art Gallery
attractions_card.description: The Majorelle Art Gallery is an art space located within Jardin Majorelle, showcasing contemporary Moroccan art and design.

attractions_card.title: El Badi Palace
attractions_card.description: El Badi Palace, in ruins today, was once a grand palace built by Saadian Sultan Ahmad al-Mansur in the late 16th century.

food_card.title: Tagine
food_card.description: Tagine is a popular Moroccan dish, cooked in a clay pot of the same name. It comes in various flavors, including lamb, chicken, and vegetarian options.

food_card.title: Couscous
food_card.description: Couscous is a staple of Moroccan cuisine, often served with flavorful stews and a variety of ingredients like vegetables, raisins, and almonds.

food_card.title: Mint Tea
food_card.description: Mint tea, or 'atai,' is a traditional Moroccan drink. It's a sweet and refreshing blend of green tea, fresh mint, and sugar, served in a unique style.

food_card.title: Pastilla
food_card.description: Pastilla is a savory-sweet pie, typically filled with pigeon or chicken, almonds, and a delicate blend of spices, wrapped in layers of thin dough.

food_card.title: Harira Soup
food_card.description: Harira is a hearty Moroccan soup, often enjoyed during Ramadan. It includes tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, and a mix of spices.

hotels_card.title: La Mamounia
hotels_card.description: La Mamounia is a luxurious hotel known for its grandeur, lush gardens, and impeccable service, located within the city's historic walls.

hotels_card.title: Royal Mansour Marrakech
hotels_card.description: The Royal Mansour Marrakech is a palace-style hotel with opulent suites, private riads, and a spa that offers a regal experience.

hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Resort Marrakech
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons Resort Marrakech offers modern luxury, beautiful gardens, and a tranquil oasis within the city.

hotels_card.title: Riad Kheirredine
hotels_card.description: Riad Kheirredine is a charming boutique hotel located in the Medina, offering a blend of traditional Moroccan design and modern comfort.

transport_card.title: Marrakech Menara Airport
transport_card.description: Marrakech Menara Airport is the main international gateway to the city, located just a few kilometers from the city center.

transport_card.title: Marrakech Railway Station
transport_card.description: Marrakech Railway Station provides train services to various cities in Morocco, making it a convenient mode of travel.

transport_card.title: Taxi Services
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Marrakech and are a common means of transportation within the city.

transport_card.title: Horse-Drawn Carriages
transport_card.description: Horse-drawn carriages, or 'caleches,' offer a traditional and scenic way to explore the city's historic sites.
